intro: Savignya parviflora var. intermedia, commonly known as the Intermediate Savignya, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural settings.
